benchmark_details.name: KOR-Bench (Knowledge-Orthogonal Reasoning Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: KOR-Bench is designed to evaluate modelsâ€™ reasoning abilities across five task categories: Operation, Logic, Cipher, Puzzle, and Counterfactual, while minimizing reliance on domain-specific knowledge.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a comprehensive benchmark that evaluates reasoning capabilities while reducing dependency on pre-existing knowledge.

data.source: Constructed using manual annotation and extensive logical reasoning tasks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of the model's output compared to the expected answers derived from the rules.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy score indicates better reasoning capabilities of the model without reliance on specific training data.
methodology.baseline_results: O1-Preview and O1-Mini models achieved accuracies of 72.88% and 70.16%, respectively.
methodology.validation: The benchmark validation has been conducted through rigorous evaluations across multiple models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: N/A - licensing details are to be specified upon full dataset release.
